Vanbrugh on cloud nine as they thrash depleted Langwith

On the final day of the college football winter league, Vanbrugh grabbed second place after demolishing a severely depleted Langwith team.

Halifax edge past spirited Wentworth

It took a string of goalkeeping heroics from Jonny Sim for Halifax to scrape a 2-1 victory over Wentworth in the term's final week of college football.

Delight for Derwent as they clinch winter league title

Derwent were crowned winter league champions after recording a 2-1 victory over James despite being put under enormous pressure for much of the second half.

Goodricke survive Alcuin fight back to finish on a high

After an erratic run of form of late, Goodricke secured a positive end to the term's college football action with victory over Alcuin.

Sports journalism: why do we do it?

I have been covering sport here at York for eight weeks now, the last five as Sports Editor, and I have very quickly realised that this job is more strenuous than most would predict.

York swimmers perform admirably in BUCS Team Championships

In the annual BUCS swimming team championships, the University of York once again performed remarkably, with the first team ending just nine points from earning a second successive promotion. (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Woods' win is a step in the right direction

Sam Morgan asks if Tiger Woods is really back after his win at the Chevron World Challenge. (Thumbnail credit Tiger Woods won his first title in two years this weekend, Image: Keith Allison via flickr Creative Commons)

Defiant netball seconds beat Newcastle for second time this term

The women's netball seconds claimed a well-earned victory against Newcastle fourths, in what turned out to be a nail-biting game with the scores close until the end. (Thumbnail credit Image: Agatha Torrance)

Reigning world champion John Higgins held an open session at York's 'Cueball Club' last week, inviting challengers to take him on in a frame

Basketballers beat Newcastle to earn first win of the season

York's men swept to victory against Newcastle Seconds by 56 points to 45 today. Cameron Lange starred, scoring 26 points in two and a half quarters as the hosts got their first win of the season.

Dan Holland analyses the end of Steve Bruce's reign as Sunderland manager. (Thumbnail credit After two and a half years, Sunderland have parted company with Steve Bruce, Image: dkodigital via flickr Creative Commons)

York edged out by Leeds Met in close affair

The men's football firsts paid the price for a slow start to their match today, losing to table-toppers Leeds Met on a bitterly cold afternoon.

York's fencers dominate Durham

York's fencers continued their bullish league form with a superb display against Durham University's seconds today, winning all three disciplines comfortably.

Men's firsts succumb to Leeds Met defeat

The men's hockey firsts suffered their fourth defeat of the season as they went down 4-0 at the hands of Leeds Met Carnegie.

Jake Farrell pays tribute to Gary Speed. (Thumbnail credit Speed managing Wales against Montenegro this year, Image: joncandy via Flickr Creative Commons)

James leave it late to stay in title race

Late goals from Dan Haresnape and Josh Brownlow saw James take all three points against Alcuin despite missing a second half penalty.

Vanbrugh keep Derwent's champagne on ice

Elliot Rous-Ross scored the only goal of the game as Vanbrugh denied Derwent the three points which would have crowned them Winter League champions.

Hutt the hero as Langwith secure shock win

A stunning strike from captain Andy Hutt gave Langwith their first victory of the season today against a lacklustre Halifax side.

Wentworth show fighting spirit in ten goal thriller

Wentworth fought back from four goals down to snatch a point against Goodricke in a thrilling encounter on 22 Acres today.

Harry Hawkins assesses the state of English rugby in light of this week's latest revelations. (Thumbnail credit Jonny Wilkinson in action for England this summer, Image: M+MD via flickr Creative Commons)

Spirited rugby firsts suffer narrow defeat to Sheffield

A brave defensive performance was not enough to prevent the men's rugby firsts going down 19-15 at the hands of Sheffield today.

Halifax hitting their stride as they knock four past 10-man Goodricke

After their shaky start to the season, Halifax look to have regained their old winning habits after recording a second win on the bounce against Goodricke today.

Derwent crush Wentworth to keep up winning run

Derwent continued their winning start to the season with a 4-0 victory against a spirited Wentworth side.

Resolute defending frustrates Langwith and Alcuin

Langwith and Alcuin played out a 1-1 draw, in a game where two goalkeeping errors determined the final result.

Late drama as Vanbrugh snatch point against James

Kieran O'Dwyer struck a dramatic late equaliser as Vanbrugh earned a 1-1 draw against James today.

York's men's water polo team secured a close win against Grimsby Town on Wednesday evening, in a tightly fought and fast-paced match.
